title.native: 少女☆歌劇 レヴュー・スタァライト

description:
The franchise centers on "Starlight" — the song and dance revue troupe loved throughout the world. Karen and Hikari make a promise with each other when they're young that one day they'll stand on that stage together. Time passes, and now the girls are 16 years old. Karen is very enthusiastic about the lessons she takes every day, holding her promise close to her heart. Hikari has transferred schools and is now away from Karen. But the cogs of fate turn, and the two are destined to meet again. The girls and other "Stage Girls" will compete in a mysterious audition process to gain acceptance into the revue.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TOPPY1218)

**Tomohiro Furukawa** is a director, storyboard artist, and animator best known for [**Shoujo☆Kageki Revue Starlight**](https://anilist.co/anime/98658/ShoujoKageki-Revue-Starlight/). Furukawa's directorial debut was in 2011 on the [*Kunihiko Ikuhara*](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara)-led [**Mawaru Penguindrum**](https://anilist.co/anime/10721/Mawaru-Penguindrum/) where by the end of the project he was co-storyboarding every episode. As a director he absorbed many 'Ikuni school' aesthetic flourishes such as recurring visual motifs with different nuance and stage direction, and infused his own action animator background into his storyboards.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/studio_pablo)

Founder and representative director of Studio Pablo.

[Website](http://meganebanchow.com/) | [Blog](http://meganebanchow.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MeganeBanchow)

Also worked on the music for Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko as part of the unit Franz Maxwell I.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/858004051778166784)

Affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/). Specializes in action scenes.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TOPPY1218)

**Tomohiro Furukawa** is a director, storyboard artist, and animator best known for [**Shoujo☆Kageki Revue Starlight**](https://anilist.co/anime/98658/ShoujoKageki-Revue-Starlight/). Furukawa's directorial debut was in 2011 on the [*Kunihiko Ikuhara*](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara)-led [**Mawaru Penguindrum**](https://anilist.co/anime/10721/Mawaru-Penguindrum/) where by the end of the project he was co-storyboarding every episode. As a director he absorbed many 'Ikuni school' aesthetic flourishes such as recurring visual motifs with different nuance and stage direction, and infused his own action animator background into his storyboards.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小島正幸) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masayuki_Kojima)

Originating from Kaname Production, currently affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

Known for directing shows such as [Monster](https://anilist.co/anime/19/), [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/) and [Hanada Shounen-shi](https://anilist.co/anime/2004/).

[Official Website](https://bushiroad.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kidanit)

Takaaki Kidani is a Japanese businessman. He is the founder and president of Bushiroad. Kidani has also served as the chairman of New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW). He continues to be involved with NJPW through Bushiroad, in which owns the company.

He founded Bushiroad in May 2007 as a company that produces card games and assumed the position of president. The origin of the name Bushiroad comes from the failure to make Neppu Kairiku Bushi Road into a film due to various reasons when he led the project in the days of Broccoli. The film was restarted in March 2013 with Kidani as the executive producer. The company would create numerous media franchises including Tantei Opera Milky Holmes and BanG Dream!

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/858004051778166784)

Affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/). Specializes in action scenes.
Youko Kogawa is a Japanese producer and planner working at Pony Canyon.
